Yes, you are right. Besides the economic benefits, language and cultural education programs for students and tourists can also promote social cohesion and foster mutual understanding, empathy, and respect among communities. These programs can also promote a sense of belonging and inclusivity, reducing stereotypes, prejudices, and discrimination.

Studies that have evaluated the social impact of language and cultural education programs have shown positive results. Participants reported increased knowledge of other cultures, enhanced language skills, improved communication and social skills, and a more positive attitude toward cultural diversity. Additionally, they have reported a sense of connection to the community and an appreciation of the local culture.

However, measuring the social impact of such programs can be complex, and it often requires qualitative and quantitative methods that can capture the complex dynamics of intercultural interactions. Therefore, further research and evaluation can help identify best practices and optimize the outcomes of language and cultural education initiatives for both locals and tourists.
